author: Special Correspondent
text:
Tirunelveli Bar Association has decided to launch an initiative for weeding out ‘fake lawyers’ by issuing identity cards to its members.

A resolution to this effect was passed at TBA’s general council meeting held here recently with its secretary R. Rajeshwaran in chair.

The meeting decided to issue identity cards to its members, for which the members would be photographed.

A team was formed for photographing the members and collecting details from them.

Another resolution decided to register only advocates below the age of 35 years as members of the TBA.

Those who wanted to become a member of the TBA after crossing this age would not be given voting rights and other monetary benefits, it said.

The meeting also decided to install five computers in TBA’s library and take sustained efforts to digitise law books and journals.

Special invitees would address the members of the TBA during the fortnightly meetings, another resolution said.
title: Initiative to weed out ‘fake lawyers’
